resources.string:
Voice Control for Plex
© 2013 Chris Bellew

Plex is copyright Plex, Inc.
Sorry, you didn\'t specify a client in the main settings, or I couldn\'t find it.
Sorry, I couldn\'t find an album to play.
Sorry, I couldn\'t find the episode you specified.
Sorry, I couldn\'t find that season.
Sorry, I couldn\'t find a track to play.
I found more than one matching album. Please specify artist.
I found more than one matching movie. Please be more specific.
Sorry, I found more than one matching show. Please be more specific.
Sorry, but I got an error: %s
Select the default client to stream media to. You can easily stream to a different client by ending your search query with \"on <client name>\", where <client name> is the name of the PHT Client.
Select which type of feedback I should give you.

Select a Plex Media Server to stream from. If you have more than one media server, select "Scan All" to search all available servers for media. If you only have one, you should select it here as scanning all servers each time will take longer to trigger playback.

Here are some examples to trigger playback:

Watch V For Vendetta
Watch Season 1 Episode 1 of Homeland
Watch Breaking Bad Season 5 Episode 8
Watch episode Once More With Feeling of Buffy The Vampire Slayer
Watch the next episode of The Walking Dead
Watch the latest episode of The Daily Show with Jon Stewart

For Music:
Listen to the album Drink The Sea by The Glitch Mob
Listen to the album Music Has The Right To Children (Artist is optional. Specify if more than one match is found)

For playback:
Pause Playback
Resume Playback
Stop Playback

Seeking:
Offset 1 hour 15 minutes 30 seconds
Offset 30 minutes 5 seconds
(Any combination of hours, minutes, and/or seconds, in that order)
(You may also use 'timecode' instead of 'offset')

If you don't have "Resume if in progress" checked, you can selectively resume by saying "Resume watching" instead of "Watch"

You can also specify a client by adding "on <client name>" to your spoken query.
Sorry, but I got an error, HTTP status code: %d

Tasker Project imported. I will now open Tasker. Please tap on the Home Icon->Import, then select Voice Control for Plex.\n\nIf you plan to use utter!, you MUST go to utter! Settings‑>Advanced‑>Try Again‑>Select \"Send to Tasker\".
Sorry, I couldn\'t find anything to play.
Voice Control For Plex works with either utter! or AutoVoice. Use the button below to import the Tasker project to enable this functionality.

The preferred method of using Voice Control for Plex is with either utter! or AutoVoice, in combination with Tasker. Use the buttons below to visit the respective applications in the Google Play Store.
